paragraphs.text: Forget the bad science. Here are my top 5 dos and don'ts of dating.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: You would be forgiven for thinking that centuries of human society would mean that we were now at a stage where we didn't need help finding another human being whom we could bear to be around and who wanted to get naked with us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But you would be mistaken
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It seems as time progresses we need more and more tactics for tricking someone into a relationship
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some people need pickup artists to help them manipulate women
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: others think"science" will provide the 21st-century love potion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the latest use of scientists' time, they have found that eating dessert on a date increases the likelihood that there'll be a second date
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This research is flawed on a number of levels, not least because you shouldn't have a meal on a first date: too many food-related potential disasters and not enough alcohol
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Plus
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you're on a date with a diabetic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , you could be responsible for putting them into a coma
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which is likely to hamper the relationship
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: here are some further helpful dos and don'ts when it comes to dating
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: 1) Don't call it dating imp
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's a horrible word and a horrible concept
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: think of it as going for a drink or to a gallery or whatever, and there being someone else there
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This relieves the pressure to be attractive and the crushing disappointment that comes with it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: 2) Do get drunk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no downside to this
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: OK, there are a couple of downsides
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The trick is to get drunk enough to be hilariously funny, intelligent and confident but not so drunk that you lower your standards and impair your ability to get the hell out of there if it becomes boring or creepy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you get so drunk that you dance on a table, start crying or vomit into your lap
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you can always blame the booze
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you don't drink
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I'm afraid there is nothing I can do for you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: best of luck
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: 3) Don't be too self-deprecating
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is a good idea to show that you don't take yourself too seriously
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it can be endearing, but keep it to the stories about giving a presentation with your skirt/shirt tucked into your knickers/Y-fronts or when you had a conversation about nobody taking you seriously while you had mustard on your face
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Save the stories about when you soiled yourself until at least the fourth date
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: You don't want to waste these comedy gold stories on someone you might only see a couple of times
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When it comes to defecating stories
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you don't want to unload your A-list stories on someone who might not be worthy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a journey of discovery
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so temporarily hold some mystery back
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: 4) Do find out their politics
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Life is too short to waste on someone who thinks Hitler had a point
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: It is good to surround yourself with people with different views to your own
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because arguments are fun
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: everyone has their red-line issues
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you might as well shake them down on these before you spend too much on booze
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So try to turn the conversation round to Ched Evans, free speech or the order of greatness of the Star Wars films
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: (which for reference is: episode V, episode IV, Episode VI, episodes I-III don't exist and should never be mentioned)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you feel they're wildly wrong on any of these subjects
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: shriek that you've left the oven on and run
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: 5) Don't talk about your ex(es) all night
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You may like to use every opportunity to talk about the profound personality flaws of your former lovers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's rather ungallant and makes you look slightly like a psychopath
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You want to hint at the fact that you have been in a relationship before
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as it implies that there are human beings who don't find your regular presence completely loathsome
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: make sure you don't get a nervous tick when you talk about it or start stabbing the table
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: these are what are known as "giveaways"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In general
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we have to be a little wary of claims that science holds the key to love
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as many myths abound
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For instance
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: pheromones don't work in humans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Dopamine is released when you're in love and when you eat chocolate, but also when you take cocaine and smoke fags
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the latter two may very well hamper your success at relationships
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Other research shows that you increase your chances of falling in love if you ask just 36 questions and then stare into their eyes for four minutes
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Which looks a lot like just showing an interest in someone and finding out you have things in common, so not exactly rocket science
paragraphs.label: assumption
